skill.name: python-performance-optimization
skill.description: Profile and optimize Python code using cProfile, memory profilers, and performance best practices. Use when debugging slow Python code, optimizing bottlenecks, or improving application performance.
skill.summary: Profile and optimize Python code using cProfile, memory profilers, and performance best practices. U...
skill.author: ActiveInferenceInstitute

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance and educational code examples for Python performance optimization. No executable code, no network access, no file system modifications. Static findings are false positives triggered by documentation patterns (code blocks, URLs in examples, standard library references).

content.value_statement: Python applications can suffer from slow performance and memory issues. This skill provides profiling tools and optimization patterns to identify bottlenecks and improve speed and efficiency.
actual_capabilities: Profile CPU usage with cProfile and pstats
Apply optimization patterns for lists, dictionaries, and strings
Optimize database queries and batch operations
limitations: Does not execute profiling on user code
Requires external profiling tools to be installed separately
Does not modify or auto-optimize user code
Does not provide real-time performance monitoring

use_cases.title: Debug Slow Applications
use_cases.description: Identify and fix performance bottlenecks in Python applications using profiling tools.

use_cases.title: Optimize Data Pipelines
use_cases.description: Improve memory efficiency and processing speed for data processing workflows.

use_cases.title: Reduce Latency
use_cases.description: Optimize API response times and database query performance for production services.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Profiling
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to profile this Python function using cProfile to identify bottlenecks.

prompt_templates.title: Memory Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: How can I track memory usage and detect memory leaks in my Python application?

prompt_templates.title: Optimization Pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Optimize this Python code snippet for better performance: [insert code]

prompt_templates.title: Production Profiling
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I profile a running Python process in production without restarting it?

output_examples.input: Profile my Python code to find performance bottlenecks
output: Sort by cumulative time to find slow functions

output_examples.input: How do I optimize memory usage in my data processing code
output: Use generators instead of lists for large datasets
Generators use constant memory vs O(n) for lists
Consider __slots__ for classes with many instances
Reduces per-object memory overhead by avoiding __dict__
Find and fix memory leaks before they grow
Profile first to identify actual bottlenecks
Use async I/O for network-bound operations
Batch database operations to reduce round-trips
Add indexes to frequently queried columns

best_practices: Profile before optimizing to identify actual bottlenecks rather than guessed issues
Use appropriate data structures like dictionaries for fast lookups instead of lists
Apply caching with lru_cache for expensive repeated computations
anti_patterns: Optimizing without profiling first leads to wasted effort on non-bottleneck code
Using global variables instead of local variables causes slower performance
Building large lists in memory when generators would use constant memory

faq.question: What Python profiling tools are supported?
faq.answer: cProfile for CPU profiling, memory_profiler for memory tracking, line_profiler for line-by-line analysis, and py-spy for production profiling.

faq.question: How long can profiling take?
faq.answer: Profiling adds minimal overhead. cProfile typically slows code by 10-20%. For production, py-spy sampling profiler has minimal impact.

faq.question: Can I integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, use pytest-benchmark for automated performance tests in CI. Set performance baselines and fail builds on regressions.

faq.question: Is my data safe during profiling?
faq.answer: Profiling only measures execution time and memory. No data is read, written, or transmitted. Safe for production with appropriate sampling rates.

faq.question: What if profiling shows no obvious bottlenecks?
faq.answer: Consider I/O-bound issues, network latency, database queries, or external API calls. Use async I/O or connection pooling.

faq.question: How is this different from other Python optimization tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides patterns and guidance. Tools like Cython or PyPy provide runtime improvements. Use both approaches together.
